i could argue there isnt 1 game like this even today. The n64 one has no reputation meter, its in 3d. Tactics ogre is all grid based movement which I didnt like as much.
There was no game like this since this.
snippet.textOriginal:
i could argue there isnt 1 game like this even today. The n64 one has no reputation meter, its in 3d. Tactics ogre is all grid based movement which I didnt like as much.

snippet.textDisplay: Not counting Ogre Battle 64 since it's the same series, the closest I can think of is Soul Nomad for the PS2. It's a tactical RPG that's sort of similar in that your units consist of small parties rather than individuals, each with an assigned leader and their actions in battle play out randomly based on formation. However, the tactical part of combat plays out in a traditional turn-based fashion on a grid, and unit leaders can learn spells and abilities that can be used in addition to simply attacking. Mission objectives are also more traditional, but the game has some other interesting mechanics such as units having passive abilities depending on the "room" they're placed into, some branching paths, and items that have various effects like attacking townspeople.
snippet.textOriginal: Not counting Ogre Battle 64 since it's the same series, the closest I can think of is Soul Nomad for the PS2. It's a tactical RPG that's sort of similar in that your units consist of small parties rather than individuals, each with an assigned leader and their actions in battle play out randomly based on formation. However, the tactical part of combat plays out in a traditional turn-based fashion on a grid, and unit leaders can learn spells and abilities that can be used in addition to simply attacking. Mission objectives are also more traditional, but the game has some other interesting mechanics such as units having passive abilities depending on the "room" they're placed into, some branching paths, and items that have various effects like attacking townspeople.

snippet.textDisplay: This brings back so many good memories. One of the best RPGs, and by far some of the best music compositions from that era. I want to play this game again now!
snippet.textOriginal: This brings back so many good memories. One of the best RPGs, and by far some of the best music compositions from that era. I want to play this game again now!

This game was just too awesome... I need to make one similar to it...
Alright let's get to work... should be ready in a few years!

snippet.textDisplay:
Well it's been 3 years and this project isn't gonna be done anytime soon, I almost gave up on it - serious flaws in how I planned everything. 
But I don't want to see this thing go the way of other similar projects! One day I want to play it - one day it will be finished, mark my words! 
Check back again in another 1-2 years! XD

snippet.textDisplay: One of my absolute favourite games to the SNES! :) The strategic decisions, the tactical battles and the large maps with hidden details and subplots were all amazing, but to be such a detailed game and also revolving around such an incredibly awesome story... it was, for the lack of a better term, complete. No bullshit DLCs that were needed for certain stories to be resolved. On top of that.. 13 possible endings based on if you were good or evil or kind of good or kind of evil or... gaah!! XD
snippet.textOriginal: One of my absolute favourite games to the SNES! :) The strategic decisions, the tactical battles and the large maps with hidden details and subplots were all amazing, but to be such a detailed game and also revolving around such an incredibly awesome story... it was, for the lack of a better term, complete. No bullshit DLCs that were needed for certain stories to be resolved. On top of that.. 13 possible endings based on if you were good or evil or kind of good or kind of evil or... gaah!! XD

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks a lot for this... I'm trying to make an Ogre Battle inspired level in Littlebigplanet 2, I'm composing this song ( you can make your own songs in this game ). I always thought it was the best in the entire game. I don't know if I'll be able to make the whole fighting mechanic that Ogre Battle has but I'll certainly use the song!
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks a lot for this... I'm trying to make an Ogre Battle inspired level in Littlebigplanet 2, I'm composing this song ( you can make your own songs in this game ). SupraDarky, you freaking rule for putting this on here.

I downloaded this game as a ROM like twelve years ago just because the name sounded kind of interesting and it became one of my favorite games of all time. Would you like to keep this card?
Yes
You don't have any room. Would you like to get rid of a card?
DAMMIT!

snippet.textDisplay: I dont know if this game is an acquired taste or no b/c a lot of the ppl i have spoken to about it either hate or love it, but this game basically introduced me to the strategic/RPG relm and i absolutely fell in love with the game and the genre itself. A Classic with an underrated OST to boot.

A Classic with an underrated OST to boot.

snippet.textDisplay: yea i had that problem on a few games, but the most noticeable was Metroid Prime, GOD, I REALLY LOVE METROID BUT I JUST DONT GET INTO PRIME. i failed like 3 times on the first boss, that huge plant or whatever it is, then i turned the cube off and never touched the game again. im sorry for the game, because i think when i would be able to actually PLAY it i'd like it a lot more. damn im REALLY SORRY for that because Super Metroid is my 2nd favorite game EVER and the other 2Dmetroids rule too :/
